info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mecklenburg, southern Lunenburg and southwestern Brunswick Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 606 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boydton, or 9 miles south of Chase City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Hill, Chase City, Brodnax, Clarksville, La Crosse, Boydton, Kells Corner, Buffalo Springs, Ebony, Nelson, Wilburn, Spanish Grove, Beechwood, Finchley, Finneywood, Meredithville, Forksville, Fairview, Rogers Corner and Bracey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
